intro: Hypericum tetrapterum var. undulatum, commonly known as the wavy-stemmed St. John's wort, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and distinctive, undulating stems that give it its common name. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It belongs to the family Hypericaceae and is known for its medicinal properties due to the presence of hypericin and pseudohypericin. This variant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
